com.jinkchak

Class Schmidt_Samoa_Encryptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jinkchak.Schmidt_Samoa_Encryptor

  • public class Schmidt_Samoa_Encryptor
extends java.lang.Object
    Schmidt-Samoa Cryptosystem Key generation • Choose two large distinct primes p and q and compute N = p2q • Compute d = N^-1 mod lcm(p – 1, q – 1) • Now N is the public key and d is the private key. Encryption: To encrypt a message m we compute the cipher text as c = m^N mod N Decryption: To decrypt a cipher text c we compute the plaintext as m = c^d mod pq which like for Rabin and RSA can be computed with the Chinese remainder theorem.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schmidt_Samoa_Encryptor()
      This constructor initializes the following variables: p - with a default value of 23 q - with a default value of 31 After that, it calls a method that computes the private and public keys

    • Method Detail

      • computeN

        private int computeN()
        Computes the value of N
        Returns:
        the value (p^2 * q)

      • correctValue

        private int correctValue(int value,
               int n)
        This method is used by the modular_Equation_Solver method to convert a negative result to a positive one. All operations are performed with mod n.
        Parameters:
        value - An Integer that has to be converted to a positive integer mod n, if it is not already positive
        n - An Integer based on which value is converted to a positive integer
        Returns:
        value, after it has been converted to a positive integer

      • decrypt

        public int decrypt(int c)
        This method decrypts only an integer. It is used by the decrypt(String) method on each block of the ciphertext.
        Parameters:
        c - An integer that has to be decrypted. It should satisfy the constraint ---- 0 < M < (p * q)
        Returns:
        An integer containing the decrypted version of c, i.e., ((c ^ private_key) mod(p * q))

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String cipher)
        Decrypts a message using the Schmidt-Samoa Algorithm. The message is split into blocks of size BLOCK_SIZE and each block is decrypted to form a plaintext string.
        Parameters:
        message - A string of cipher text.
        Returns:
        A string containing the plain text

      • display

        public java.lang.String display()
        Displays all details of the following values: p q Public Key Private Key
        Returns:
        A string containing these values

      • encrypt

        public int encrypt(int m)
        This method encrypts only an integer. It is used by the encrypt(String) method on each block of the plaintext *
        Parameters:
        m - An integer that has to be encrypted
        Returns:
        An integer containing an encrypted version of m, i.e., ((m ^ public_key) mod (public_key))

      • encrypt

        public java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String message)
        Encrypts a message using the Schmidt-Samoa Algorithm. The message is split into blocks of size BLOCK_SIZE and each block is encrypted to form a cipher string. If a given block is less than the BLOCK_SIZE, then the toNLengthString() method is called to convert the block to a string of size BLOCK_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        message - A string of plaintext.
        Returns:
        A string containing the cipher text

      • extendedEuclidsAlgo

        private int[] extendedEuclidsAlgo(int a,
                        int b)
        This method contains an implementation of the extended Euclidean algorithm. The extended Euclidean algorithm is an extension to the Euclidean algorithm. Besides finding the greatest common divisor of two integers, as the Euclidean algorithm does, it also finds integers x and y (one of which is typically negative) that satisfy Bézout's identity: ax + by = gcd(a, b)
        Parameters:
        a - An integer
        b - An integer
        Returns:
        An integer array z consisting of three element: z[0] = gcd(a, b) z[1] = x z[2] = y

        Returns:

      • modular_Equation_Solver

        private int modular_Equation_Solver(int a,
                          int b,
                          int n)
                             throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        This method contains an implementation of the Modular Equation solver as defined in the CLRS text book. It finds x in the modular equation: ax = b mod n. This method returns only the first value of x
        Parameters:
        a - An Integer
        b - An Integer
        n - An Integer
        Returns:
        The first value of x that satisfies the modular equation
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

      • modularExponentiator

        public int modularExponentiator(int a,
                       int b,
                       int n)
        This method implements the modular exponentiation algorithm as defined in the CLRS text book. It finds out the result of (a^b) mod n, even when b is very very large
        Parameters:
        a - An integer that has to be raised to the power b
        b - An integer that denotes the power to which a has to be raised.
        n - An integer based on which all multiplication operations are performed (mod n)
        Returns:
        An integer containing the result of ((a ^ b) mod n)

      • reInitialize

        public void reInitialize(int p,
                int q)
        Re-initializes the system with the new values for p and q, and then computes the new values of the public and private keys.
        Parameters:
        p - A large prime number
        q - A large prime number that is distinct from q

      • toNLengthString

        private java.lang.String toNLengthString(java.lang.String str,
                               int n)
        Converts a string of length m <= n, to a string of length n by inserting zeroes at the beginning of str.
        Parameters:
        str - A string consisting of at most n characters
        n - An integer, denoting the total number of characters that str should contain
        Returns:
        A string containing the value of str with a length of n characters
